result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Q Ruby was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Report forthwith
Huber granted
May serve in Outagamie County
Consecutive to: any other sentence
Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Q Ruby

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

9:46 AM Defendant Michael Q Ruby appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for Michael Q Ruby.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Gumz states that the matter is resolved.  Atty Gumz asks for a breakout room.

9:50am  BACK ON THE RECORD:
Atty Gumz states that yes the matter is resolved today.  

Court questions the defendant regarding in-person appearance.  Defendant waives their in-person appearance today & will proceed by zoom. 

Atty Burdon states plea agreement to Count 2.  Count 1 to be dismissed and read-in.  Atty Gumz agrees.  Defendant agrees.

Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Defendant enters a No Contest plea.  
Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds the defendant guilty of Count 2 and orders the judgment of conviction as of today's date. 
Count 1 to be dismissed and read-in

Atty Burdon makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Count 2:  Court orders 30 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; consecutive to any other sentence 
Report forthwith
May serve in Outagamie County
Credit = 0 days
Court Costs = $243.00
Submit DNA sample within 60 days and pay surcharge = $200.00

2:49 PM Defendant Michael Q Ruby not in court.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for Michael Q Ruby.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Gumz states that the defendant is in custody in Outagamie County.  Atty Gumz asks for another status date.

BY THE COURT:  Set status
bond continued
Status hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Status hearing on September 27, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Status hearing on August 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription **Bond to be signed and returned to the COC office within 14 days

10:10 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael Q Ruby appeared by video.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for Michael Q Ruby. 
Atty Gumz states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 
Court confirms address. Atty Gumz waives time limits for the Prelim.  Defendant agrees.  

Atty Juech has no objection to a signature bond with conditions. 

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $1,000 Signature bond with conditions:
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription 
**Bond to be signed and returned to the COC office within 14 days 

BY THE COURT:  Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing.
Status hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status hearing on June 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
